techmeme.title: TechCrunch has shut down its operations in Europe; one former staffer says new owner Regent thought "international startup coverage wasn't essential" (Sifted)
Researchers detail a technique Meta uses to glean some of its logged-in users' browsing histories from Chromium-based browsers on Android via web identifiers (Dan Goodin/Ars Technica)
A website for "$TRUMP Wallet" launches, saying it is "The Official $TRUMP Wallet by President Trump" powered by NFT service Magic Eden, and opens a waitlist (Molly White/Citation Needed)
TikTok expands Manage Topics, a feature that lets users customize how often specific topics appear in the For You feed, and adds AI-powered keyword filtering (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Nintendo says it didn't send any Switch 2 review units to outlets as "important features and updates" will only be available via an update on its June 5 launch (Andy Robinson/Video Games Chronicle)
